meanings.definition: Admit (someone) formally to a position or organization.
meanings.sent1: The principal will induct the new student into the school.
meanings.sent2: They will induct the new employee into the company with a welcoming ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to induct the rabbit into the hat, but it didn't quite fit.
meanings.sent4: The warm weather seemed to induct a sense of happiness in everyone.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance will induct you into the world of professional networking.
